publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4023 Robin Harper: International Self Harm Awareness Day—That the Parliament recognises the work being done by health care professionals, social services, child protection services, the voluntary sector, LifeSIGNS, the National Self Harm Network, Samaritans, Childline and the "See me" campaign to combat the seriously high numbers of people who self harm every year; views with utmost concern the latest figures that indicate that one-in-10 people self harm, this figure being based only on the numbers who admit to causing themselves harm; calls on the Scottish Executive and all concerned organisations to recognise 1 March 2006 as self harm awareness day; calls for full support for all organisations in their efforts to address what is a very serious problem, and congratulates the Scottish Executive for the support it is presently giving to the "See me" campaign.

S2M-4023 International Self Harm Awareness Day (lodged on 27 February 2006) Pauline McNeill*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr David Davidson*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Rob Gibson*, Christine Grahame*, Jackie Baillie*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Bill Butler*, Scott Barrie*, Mark Ballard*, Frances Curran*, Eleanor Scott*, Chris Ballance*

S2M-4023 International Self Harm Awareness Day (lodged on 27 February 2006) Marilyn Livingstone*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-4023 International Self Harm Awareness Day (lodged on 27 February 2006) Marlyn Glen*, Mary Scanlon*, Trish Godman*, Shiona Baird*, Alex Neil*, Patrick Harvie*

S2M-4023 Robin Harper: International Self Harm Awareness Day—That the Parliament recognises the work being done by health care professionals, social services, child protection services, the voluntary sector, LifeSIGNS, the National Self Harm Network, Samaritans, Childline and the "See me" campaign to combat the seriously high numbers of people who self harm every year; views with utmost concern the latest figures that indicate that one-in-10 people self harm, this figure being based only on the numbers who admit to causing themselves harm; calls on the Scottish Executive and all concerned organisations to recognise 1 March 2006 as self harm awareness day; calls for full support for all organisations in their efforts to address what is a very serious problem, and congratulates the Scottish Executive for the support it is presently giving to the "See me" campaign. Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Dr Elaine Murray, Rob Gibson, Christine Grahame, Jackie Baillie, Mr Frank McAveety, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Bill Butler, Scott Barrie, Mark Ballard, Frances Curran, Eleanor Scott, Chris Ballance, Marilyn Livingstone, Mrs Nanette Milne, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Mr Jamie Stone, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Adam Ingram, Nora Radcliffe, Marlyn Glen, Mary Scanlon, Trish Godman, Shiona Baird, Alex Neil, Patrick Harvie
S2M-4023 International Self Harm Awareness Day (lodged on 27 February 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4023 International Self Harm Awareness Day (lodged on 27 February 2006) Cathy Peattie*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-4023 International Self Harm Awareness Day (lodged on 27 February 2006) Irene Oldfather*
S2M-4023 International Self Harm Awareness Day (lodged on 27 February 2006) Linda Fabiani*
